<!-- TOC_END -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228987Z10-K_HTM_BG10701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228987Z10-K_HTM_CE10701_ITEM_7__MANAGEMENT_S_DISCUSSIO__ITE03649">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228987Z10-K_HTM_TOC_CE10701_1">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM 7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We have prepared this Management's Discussion and Analysis as an aid to understanding our financial results. It should be read in conjunction with
	the accompanying Consolidated Financial Statements and related Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements. We begin with an introduction to our key businesses and then provide discussions of our
	results of operations, liquidity and capital resources, and critical accounting policies. It is important to note that our fiscal year 2016 included 53&nbsp;weeks, whereas fiscal years 2015 and 2014
	included 52&nbsp;weeks. The additional week in fiscal 2016 was included in our fourth quarter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	This
	Management's Discussion and Analysis reflects results for only our continuing operations, unless otherwise noted. During fiscal 2014, we sold substantially all of the assets of our Bauhaus U.S.A.
	business unit, and we marketed for sale our youth furniture business, Lea Industries, a division of La-Z-Boy Casegoods,&nbsp;Inc. (formerly known as La-Z-Boy Greensboro,&nbsp;Inc.). We were unable
	to find a buyer for the Lea Industries business, and instead we ceased operations and liquidated all the assets, consisting mostly of inventory, during fiscal 2015. In the accompanying financial
	statements, we reported the operating results of Bauhaus and Lea Industries as discontinued operations for all periods presented. For the fiscal years ended April&nbsp;25, 2015, and April&nbsp;26,
	2014, we recorded pre-tax income of $0.9&nbsp;million ($0.6&nbsp;million after tax) and a pre-tax loss of $6.0&nbsp;million ($3.8&nbsp;million after tax), respectively, in discontinued
	operations related to these businesses. We previously reported results of Bauhaus as a component of our Upholstery segment, and Lea Industries as a component of our Casegoods segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	fiscal 2015, we also recorded $4.2&nbsp;million of pre-tax income ($2.7&nbsp;million after tax) in discontinued operations related to the Continued Dumping and Subsidy Offset Act of 2000
	("CDSOA"). Before the Act was revised in 2007, it provided that duties collected on wooden bedroom furniture imported from China were to be distributed to domestic producers that supported the
	antidumping petition that resulted in the duties. Of the $4.2&nbsp;million pre-tax income we received, $3.8&nbsp;million related to our previously owned subsidiary, American Furniture Company,
	Incorporated. We sold this subsidiary in fiscal 2007 and reported it as discontinued operations at that time. When we sold the assets of American Furniture Company, Incorporated our contract provided
	that we would receive a portion of any such duties to which that entity was entitled. The remainder of the CDSOA pre-tax income reported in discontinued operations related to Lea Industries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Introduction
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Our Business
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We manufacture, market, import, export, distribute and retail upholstery furniture products. In addition, we import, distribute and retail
	accessories and casegoods (wood) furniture products. We are the leading global producer of reclining chairs and the second largest manufacturer/distributor of residential furniture in the United
	States. The La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries&reg; stores retail network is the third largest retailer of single-branded furniture in the United States. We have seven major North American
	manufacturing locations and six regional retail distribution centers in the United States to support our speed-to-market and customization strategy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	sell our products, primarily in the United States and Canada but also internationally, to furniture retailers and directly to consumers through stores that we own and operate. The centerpiece of
	our
	retail distribution strategy is our network of 338 La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries&reg; stores and 559 Comfort Studio&reg; locations, each dedicated to marketing our La-Z-Boy branded
	products. We consider this dedicated space to be "branded outlets" or "proprietary." We own 124 of the La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries&reg; stores. The remainder of the La-Z-Boy Furniture
	Galleries&reg; stores, as well as all 559 Comfort Studio&reg; locations, are independently owned and operated. La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries&reg;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	24
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=25,EFW="2228987",CP="LA-Z-BOY",DN="1",CHK=388016,FOLIO='24',FILE='DISK123:[16ZAY1.16ZAY10701]CE10701A.;15',USER='JKEENE',CD='21-JUN-2016;10:42' -->
<A NAME="A2228987Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_CE10701_1_25">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228987Z10-K_HTM_BG10701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	stores
	help consumers furnish their homes by combining the style, comfort and quality of La-Z-Boy furniture with our available In-Home Design service. La-Z-Boy Comfort Studio&reg; locations
	are defined spaces within larger independent retailers that are dedicated to displaying and selling La-Z-Boy branded products. In addition to the La-Z-Boy Comfort Studio&reg; locations, our
	Kincaid and England operating units have their own dedicated proprietary in-store programs with 500 outlets and over 1.5&nbsp;million square feet of proprietary floor space. In total, our
	proprietary floor space includes approximately 9.3&nbsp;million square feet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	goal is to deliver value to our shareholders with improved sales and earnings over the long term through the execution of our strategic initiatives. The foundation of our strategic initiatives is
	driving sales growth in all areas of our business, but most importantly in our flagship La-Z-Boy brand. We are driving this growth in four ways:
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We are expanding our branded distribution channels by executing our 4-4-5 store growth initiative, through which we plan to expand the
	La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries&reg; stores network to 400 stores averaging $4&nbsp;million in sales per store over the five-year period that began with fiscal 2014. We just completed year
	three of this initiative, which has been delivering results for us, as noted by the network's achievement of our average sales per store target of $4&nbsp;million per store during calendar 2015,
	more than two years ahead of schedule. Although we now expect the store build out to extend beyond five years, we believe as the average revenue per store increases, the same economic value could be
	delivered by the network in that time frame. Through this initiative, we intend not only to increase the number of stores but also to improve their quality, including upgrading old format stores to
	our new design concept through remodels and relocations. In addition, we are increasing our La-Z-Boy Comfort Studio&reg; locations, our store-within-a-store format, as another avenue to expand
	our branded distribution channels. We expect these initiatives to generate growth in our Retail segment through an increased company-owned store count, and to generate growth in our wholesale
	Upholstery segment as our proprietary distribution network expands, in both cases with higher average sales per store.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We are growing the size of our company-owned retail business by acquiring La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries&reg; stores that are
	owned by our independent dealers, primarily in markets where we see opportunity for growth or where we believe there are opportunities for further market penetration.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We are increasing our market share with the growth of sales through our multi-channel distribution network. In addition to the almost
	900 branded outlets dedicated to selling La-Z-Boy product (La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries&reg; stores and La-Z-Boy Comfort Studio&reg; locations), approximately 1,900 other dealers sell
	La-Z-Boy products. These outlets include some of the best known names in the industry, such as Art Van, Nebraska Furniture Mart, and Slumberland. Additionally, our other brands&#151;England,
	American Drew, Hammary, and Kincaid&#151;enjoy distribution through a combined 1,500 dealers. We believe there is significant growth potential for our brands through these retail channels.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We are also increasing our market share in stationary upholstered furniture through a combination of our
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Live
	Life Comfortably
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&reg; marketing campaign, featuring Brooke Shields as our brand ambassador, and our innovative and on-trend product. We continue to invest in this
	campaign, aimed at changing the image of our brand and widening La-Z-Boy's appeal among a broader consumer demographic. While we are known for our iconic recliners, we sell more of all the other types
	of furniture in our portfolio than recliners. Also, integral to the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Live Life Comfortably
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&reg; campaign is our Urban Attitudes&reg;
	collection of smaller-scale stationary furniture targeted at a more style-conscious demographic, younger consumers, and people who live in smaller spaces in urban locations. Stationary upholstery
	furniture is a significant share of the industry's total upholstery furniture sales, and we believe that over time we can capture a larger share of demand for these products.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	25
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=26,EFW="2228987",CP="LA-Z-BOY",DN="1",CHK=373908,FOLIO='25',FILE='DISK123:[16ZAY1.16ZAY10701]CE10701A.;15',USER='JKEENE',CD='21-JUN-2016;10:42' -->
<A NAME="A2228987Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_CE10701_1_26">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228987Z10-K_HTM_BG10701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Additionally,
	we are focused on improving profitability through operational excellence in our supply chain, which includes our procurement and manufacturing operations. We implemented a corporate
	center of excellence for supply chain management, through which we are transitioning our supply chain efforts from being run by our individual operating companies to being managed on a
	corporation-wide basis, in order to leverage efficiencies, savings opportunities, and relationships with vendors. One key aspect of this strategy was our establishment of a global trading company in
	Hong Kong. During fiscal 2016, our wholesale segments benefited from the efficiencies that this strategy generated throughout our supply chain.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	fiscal 2016, the number of stores in the La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries&reg; store network increased by 13 stores to 338, while the number of company-owned retail stores increased by 14
	stores to 124. The 14 additional company-owned retail stores included 11 that we acquired from independent dealers and five new stores, partly offset by two store closures during the fiscal year. We
	improved sales through volume increases in our Upholstery and Retail segments, while also delivering a higher operating margin in both segments. We achieved the improvement in our Upholstery segment
	profitability mainly through improved efficiencies in our supply chain, and increased our Retail segment's operating margin mainly through higher sales volume in stores that had been open for at least
	12&nbsp;months and a higher percentage of custom orders. While our Casegoods sales volume decreased compared with last year, our restructuring of that business to an all-import model is working as
	we intended, and we believe the business will now deliver more consistent performance going forward.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	reportable operating segments are the Upholstery segment, the Casegoods segment, and the Retail segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Upholstery Segment.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Upholstery segment is our largest
	business and consists primarily of two operating units: La-Z-Boy, our largest operating unit, and our England subsidiary. Our Upholstery segment manufactures and imports upholstered furniture such as
	recliners and motion furniture, sofas, loveseats, chairs, sectionals, modulars, ottomans and sleeper sofas. The Upholstery segment sells directly to La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries&reg; stores,
	operators of La-Z-Boy Comfort Studio&reg; locations and England Custom Comfort Center locations, major dealers, and a wide cross-section of other independent retailers.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Casegoods Segment.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Casegoods segment is an importer,
	marketer and distributor of casegoods (wood) furniture such as bedroom sets, dining room sets, entertainment centers and occasional pieces, and also manufactures some coordinated upholstered
	furniture. The Casegoods segment consists of three brands: American Drew, Hammary, and Kincaid. The Casegoods segment sells directly to major dealers, as well as La-Z-Boy Furniture
	Galleries&reg; stores, and a wide cross-section of other independent retailers.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Retail Segment.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Retail segment consists of 124
	company-owned La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries&reg; stores. The Retail segment primarily sells upholstered furniture, in addition to some casegoods and other accessories, to the end consumer
	through our retail network.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Results of Operations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	26

<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=27,EFW="2228987",CP="LA-Z-BOY",DN="1",CHK=581668,FOLIO='26',FILE='DISK123:[16ZAY1.16ZAY10701]CE10701A.;15',USER='JKEENE',CD='21-JUN-2016;10:42' -->
<A NAME="A2228987Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_CE10701_1_27">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228987Z10-K_HTM_BG10701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Sales
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our consolidated sales increased $100.0&nbsp;million in fiscal 2016 over fiscal 2015, following an increase of $68.1&nbsp;million in fiscal 2015
	over fiscal 2014. As a reminder, fiscal 2016 contained 53&nbsp;weeks, while fiscal 2015 and 2014 had 52&nbsp;weeks.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The increases in sales in both fiscal 2016 and fiscal 2015 compared with the prior years were due to higher sales in our Retail and
	Upholstery segments. Our Retail segment sales continued to benefit from volume increases in our stores that had been open for a minimum of 12&nbsp;months, in addition to sales from new and acquired
	stores. Our Upholstery segment sales increase over the last two years was driven by stronger unit volume. Our Casegoods segment has been working through a restructuring of its business, and sales in
	fiscal 2016 were lower than the prior year due mainly to the elimination of our hospitality product line and higher sales in fiscal 2015 that were the result of increased promotional activity of our
	older product lines.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The additional week in fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal 2015 accounted for approximately 2% of fiscal 2016's total sales.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Operating Margin
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our operating margin increased 0.8&nbsp;percentage point in fiscal 2016 compared with the prior year, following an increase of
	0.6&nbsp;percentage point in fiscal 2015 compared with the prior year.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our gross margin increased 2.8&nbsp;percentage points during fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal 2015, following a
	1.2&nbsp;percentage point increase in fiscal 2015 compared with fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our Upholstery segment gross margin improved in both fiscal 2016 and fiscal 2015 compared with the prior years. Fiscal 2016 gross
	margin improved primarily due to supply chain efficiencies, as well as favorable changes in our product mix, which reversed the performance in fiscal 2015, when inefficiencies in our supply chain and
	unfavorable changes in our product mix lowered our gross margin when compared with fiscal 2014. The inefficiencies in fiscal 2015 were a result of implementing our ERP system in all our branded
	upholstery plants. In fiscal 2016, through improved inventory procurement, product flow, and leveraging the benefits of our ERP system in our branded upholstery plants, we were able to operate more
	efficiently than in the prior fiscal year. Both fiscal 2016 and fiscal 2015 included the benefit of favorable legal settlements, which provided a 0.3&nbsp;percentage point and 0.4&nbsp;percentage
	point benefit, respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our Retail segment gross margin improved in both fiscal 2016 and fiscal 2015 compared with the prior years due to increased custom
	orders and In-Home Design orders, which generate a higher gross margin than sales of stock units.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our Casegoods segment gross margin improved in both fiscal 2016 and fiscal 2015 compared with the prior years due to our transition to
	an all-import model for our wood furniture and our consolidation of our casegoods operations. Additionally, the segment's fiscal 2015 gross margin included the benefit of a reduction in our LIFO
	reserves during that time period.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our gross margin improved 0.9&nbsp;percentage point and 0.5&nbsp;percentage point in fiscal 2016 and fiscal 2015, respectively,
	due to changes in our consolidated sales mix. Our consolidated sales mix changed due to the growth of our Retail segment, which has a higher gross margin than our wholesale segments.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our selling, general, and administrative ("SG&amp;A") expense as a percentage of sales increased 2.0&nbsp;percentage points during
	fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal 2015, following a 0.6&nbsp;percentage point increase in fiscal 2015 as compared with fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	27
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=28,EFW="2228987",CP="LA-Z-BOY",DN="1",CHK=967921,FOLIO='27',FILE='DISK123:[16ZAY1.16ZAY10701]CE10701A.;15',USER='JKEENE',CD='21-JUN-2016;10:42' -->
<A NAME="A2228987Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_CE10701_1_28">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228987Z10-K_HTM_BG10701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Professional fees and legal costs were 0.5&nbsp;percentage point higher and 0.3&nbsp;percentage point higher during fiscal 2016
	and fiscal 2015, respectively, primarily due to legal fees and a $5.5&nbsp;million accrual for a pending legal matter associated with a lawsuit over a contract dispute, as well as spending for our
	continued ERP implementation and our new e-commerce web site. The pending legal matter, which was previously announced, is currently under review by the court and the court could overturn the verdict
	which could result in the entire accrual being reversed. Additionally, if the verdict is overturned, that decision could be appealed, which could result in additional expense in future periods in
	defense of that appeal.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Higher costs associated with our new world headquarters, primarily depreciation, resulted in a 0.4&nbsp;percentage point increase in
	SG&amp;A expense as a percentage of sales during fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal 2015. Distribution costs, primarily from expanding our regional retail distribution centers network, resulted in a
	0.3&nbsp;percentage point increase during fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Incentive compensation costs resulted in a 0.3&nbsp;percentage point increase in SG&amp;A expense as percentage of sales during fiscal
	2016 compared to fiscal 2015, following a 0.5&nbsp;percentage point decrease in fiscal 2015 compared to fiscal 2014. These costs were higher in fiscal 2016 primarily due to an improvement in our
	current year consolidated financial performance against our incentive-based targets compared with our financial performance in the prior year against the prior year targets. Our financial performance
	in fiscal 2015 was lower against that year's incentive-based targets when compared with fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Warranty expense was 0.2&nbsp;percentage point higher as a percent of sales during fiscal 2016 and fiscal 2015, compared with the
	respective prior year. Our warranty expense was higher primarily due to higher replacement part costs and labor costs from our more complex product lines. Additionally, our warranty expense was higher
	during fiscal 2016 due to favorable accrual adjustments during fiscal 2015 which reflected a change in the prior estimates of our product warranty liability during that time period.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our SG&amp;A expense increased as a percent of sales by 1.2&nbsp;percentage points and 0.8&nbsp;percentage point in fiscal 2016 and
	fiscal 2015, respectively, due to the growth of our Retail segment, which has a higher level of SG&amp;A expense as a percent of sales than our wholesale segments.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	These
	items are further explained in the discussion of each segment's results later in this Management's Discussion and Analysis.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_16"></A>

	%

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Sales
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our Upholstery segment's sales increased $64.0&nbsp;million in fiscal 2016 over fiscal 2015, following an increase of $52.8&nbsp;million in
	fiscal 2015 over fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Increased unit volume in both fiscal 2016 and fiscal 2015 drove a 4.3% and 4.2% sales increase, respectively, compared with the prior
	year. We believe the increased unit volume over the two-year period was a result of our
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Live Life Comfortably
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&reg; marketing campaign, the
	strength of our stationary product introductions, and our improved product value and styling. Included in the increased volume is the additional week in fiscal 2016, which accounted for approximately
	2% of the total fiscal 2016 sales volume.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	28
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=29,EFW="2228987",CP="LA-Z-BOY",DN="1",CHK=415727,FOLIO='28',FILE='DISK123:[16ZAY1.16ZAY10701]CE10701A.;15',USER='JKEENE',CD='21-JUN-2016;10:42' -->
<A NAME="A2228987Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_CE10701_1_29">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228987Z10-K_HTM_BG10701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Favorable changes in our product mix in fiscal 2016 resulted in a 1.1% increase in sales compared with fiscal 2015. Our product mix
	included a shift to more powered motion units and an increase in motion sofas as compared with the prior year. Powered motion units have a higher average selling price than motion units without power,
	as do motion sofas as compared with stationary products.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Unfavorable changes in our product mix in fiscal 2015 resulted in a 0.6% decrease in sales compared with fiscal 2014. Our product mix
	in fiscal 2015 included a shift to more recliners and stationary units, including a shift from motion sofas to stationary sofas and occasional chairs, as well as a shift to more fabric units and fewer
	leather units. Motion sofas and leather units have a higher average selling price compared to stationary units and fabric units.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Higher selling prices in fiscal 2015 resulted in 1.0% of the sales increase compared to fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Operating Margin
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our Upholstery segment's operating margin increased 0.5&nbsp;percentage point in fiscal 2016 compared with the prior year, following a decrease of
	0.2&nbsp;percentage point in fiscal 2015 compared with fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The segment's gross margin increased 1.9&nbsp;percentage points during fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal 2015, following a
	0.3&nbsp;percentage point increase during fiscal 2015 compared with fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The main driver of changes in our gross margin was the performance of our supply chain, which includes our procurement and
	manufacturing operations. During fiscal 2016, improved efficiencies in our supply chain resulted in a 1.9&nbsp;percentage point improvement in the segment's gross margin, which reversed the
	performance in fiscal 2015, when inefficiencies in our supply chain lowered our gross margin by 0.6&nbsp;percentage point, when compared with fiscal 2014. The inefficiencies in fiscal 2015 were a
	result of implementing our ERP system in all our branded upholstery plants. In fiscal 2016, through improved inventory procurement, product flow, and leveraging the benefits of our ERP system in our
	branded upholstery plants, we were able to operate more efficiently than in the prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Additionally, the segment's gross margin was impacted by favorable legal settlements, which provided a benefit of
	0.3&nbsp;percentage point and 0.5&nbsp;percentage point, respectively, in fiscal 2016 and fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The segment's SG&amp;A expense as a percentage of sales increased 1.4&nbsp;percentage points during fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal
	2015, following an increase of 0.5&nbsp;percentage point during fiscal 2015 compared with fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Professional fees and legal costs were 1.0&nbsp;percentage point higher as a percent of sales during fiscal 2016, primarily due to
	legal fees and a $5.5&nbsp;million accrual for a pending legal matter associated with a lawsuit over a contract dispute, as well as spending for our continued ERP implementation. The pending legal
	matter, which was previously announced, is currently under review by the court and the court could overturn the verdict which could result in the entire accrual being reversed. Additionally, if the
	verdict is overturned, that decision could be appealed, which could result in additional expense in future periods in defense of that appeal.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Warranty expense was 0.3&nbsp;percentage point higher as a percent of sales during fiscal 2016. Our warranty expense was higher
	primarily due to higher replacement part costs and labor costs from our more complex product lines. Additionally, our warranty expense was higher during fiscal 2016 due to favorable accrual
	adjustments during fiscal 2015 which reflected a change in the prior estimates of our product warranty liability during that time period.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Professional fees were 0.4&nbsp;percentage point higher as a percent of sales during fiscal 2015, primarily due to spending for
	investment in our business. The investments included higher costs for technology improvements, including our ERP system and our website and e-commerce platform.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
</DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	29
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=30,EFW="2228987",CP="LA-Z-BOY",DN="1",CHK=566829,FOLIO='29',FILE='DISK123:[16ZAY1.16ZAY10701]CE10701A.;15',USER='JKEENE',CD='21-JUN-2016;10:42' -->
<A NAME="A2228987Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_CE10701_1_30">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228987Z10-K_HTM_BG10701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_17"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Casegoods Segment
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:67%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Sales
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our Casegoods segment's sales decreased $7.2&nbsp;million in fiscal 2016 over fiscal 2015, following an increase of $3.0&nbsp;million in fiscal
	2015 over fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	When we ceased domestic manufacturing of our wood furniture, we eliminated our hospitality product line, which resulted in
	$3.7&nbsp;million lower sales in fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal 2015. In addition, as we have shifted our product line to more transitional and casual styles over the last few years, we have been
	selling through older product lines. Higher promotional activity related to these product lines during fiscal 2015 resulted in higher sales during that period. These items were both somewhat offset by
	the additional week in fiscal 2016, which resulted in approximately 2% of additional sales.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In fiscal 2015, increased unit volume drove a 2.8% increase in sales compared with fiscal 2014. We believe the increased unit volume
	was a result of new collections we introduced as part of shifting our product styling to more transitional and casual styles, as well as strength in our occasional business, partly offset by higher
	promotional activity as we sold through older, more traditional product. In addition, we had $1.9&nbsp;million lower sales of hospitality product in fiscal 2015 compared with fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Operating Margin
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our Casegoods segment's operating margin increased 1.7&nbsp;percentage points in fiscal 2016 compared with the prior year, following an increase of
	2.6&nbsp;percentage points in fiscal 2015 compared with the prior year.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The segment's gross margin increased 0.9&nbsp;percentage point during fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal 2015, following an increase
	of 2.5&nbsp;percentage points during fiscal 2015 compared with fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During fiscal 2016, the transition to an all-import model for our wood furniture and the consolidation of our casegoods operations, as
	well as less discounting due to lower promotional activity in fiscal 2016, drove the improved gross margin for the segment.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During fiscal 2015, the segment's gross margin was positively impacted by a $2.1&nbsp;million reduction in our LIFO reserve
	associated with a portion of our domestically manufactured inventory which was liquidated in fiscal 2015. We ceased manufacturing product domestically during fiscal 2015, and we reduced our LIFO
	reserve since the stream of domestically manufactured inventory will not be replaced. This reduction resulted in a 2.4&nbsp;percentage point improvement in gross margin for the segment.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The segment's SG&amp;A expense as a percentage of sales decreased 0.8&nbsp;percentage point during fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal
	2015, following a 0.1&nbsp;percentage point decrease during fiscal 2015 compared with fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During fiscal 2016, the decreased SG&amp;A expense was mainly due to lower incentive compensation resulting from lower financial
	performance of the segment against the incentive-based targets compared with our financial performance in the prior year against the prior year
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
</DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	30
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=31,EFW="2228987",CP="LA-Z-BOY",DN="1",CHK=943386,FOLIO='30',FILE='DISK123:[16ZAY1.16ZAY10701]CE10701A.;15',USER='JKEENE',CD='21-JUN-2016;10:42' -->
<A NAME="A2228987Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_CE10701_1_31">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228987Z10-K_HTM_BG10701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	targets.
	Also, we decreased our SG&amp;A expense through the consolidation of our casegoods operations into one corporate office and the elimination of redundant expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During fiscal 2015, the decreased SG&amp;A expense was mainly due to improved leverage of fixed SG&amp;A costs resulting from the higher sales
	volume. This decrease was somewhat offset by higher incentive compensation costs due to the segment's improved financial performance in fiscal 2015 compared with fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Sales
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our Retail segment's sales increased $68.5&nbsp;million in fiscal 2016 over fiscal 2015, following an increase of $35.3&nbsp;million in fiscal
	2015 over fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In fiscal 2016, the segment's sales increase was due in part to higher sales volume for stores that had been open for a minimum of
	12&nbsp;months, which increased 7.5% or $14.0&nbsp;million, compared with fiscal 2015. The increased volume was primarily a result of higher average ticket sales, driven by a higher percentage of
	custom orders, increased In-Home Design orders, and a shift to more powered units. Our acquired stores added $22.4&nbsp;million in sales for the segment in fiscal 2016, and the remainder of the
	sales increase came from our new and closed stores. The additional week in fiscal 2016 accounted for approximately 2% of total fiscal 2016 sales.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In fiscal 2015, we were able to convert lower traffic into an increase in ticket count and units per ticket, which resulted in a 3.0%
	sales increase for our stores that had been open for a minimum of 12&nbsp;months. In addition, sales were higher in fiscal 2015 compared with the prior year due to the sales volume of our new and
	acquired stores, our
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Live Life Comfortably&reg;
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	marketing campaign, the strength of our stationary product introductions and our improved
	product value and styling.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Operating Margin
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our Retail segment's operating margin increased 3.0&nbsp;percentage points in fiscal 2016 compared with the prior year, following a
	0.3&nbsp;percentage point decrease in fiscal 2015 compared with the prior year.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The segment's gross margin increased 1.3&nbsp;percentage points during fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal 2015, following a
	0.9&nbsp;percentage point decrease in fiscal 2015 as compared with fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During fiscal 2016, a higher percentage of custom orders, increased In-Home Design orders, and a shift to more powered units drove the
	increase in gross margin compared with fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During fiscal 2015, higher promotional activity, which drove our ability to convert lower traffic into an increase in ticket count and
	units per ticket, negatively impacted our gross margin compared with fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The segment's SG&amp;A expense as a percentage of sales decreased 1.7&nbsp;percentage points during fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal
	2015, following a 0.6&nbsp;percentage point decrease in fiscal 2015 compared with fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	31
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=32,EFW="2228987",CP="LA-Z-BOY",DN="1",CHK=207030,FOLIO='31',FILE='DISK123:[16ZAY1.16ZAY10701]CE10701A.;15',USER='JKEENE',CD='21-JUN-2016;10:42' -->
<A NAME="A2228987Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_CE10701_1_32">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228987Z10-K_HTM_BG10701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our sales volume increases in both fiscal 2016 and fiscal 2015 from stores that had been open for a minimum of 12&nbsp;months
	allowed us to leverage our fixed SG&amp;A expenses (primarily occupancy and administrative costs) as a percentage of sales in both fiscal years.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Somewhat offsetting the leverage of fixed SG&amp;A expenses was spending for investment in our business. In fiscal 2016, we increased
	advertising spending by 0.4&nbsp;percentage point as a percent of sales on our
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Live Life Comfortably
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&reg; marketing campaign and on
	promotional marketing to support our retail stores and enhance our share of voice in selected markets. In fiscal 2015, as the pace of our 4-4-5 growth strategy accelerated, we incurred higher costs
	related to new store openings compared with the prior year. These investments reduced operating income by approximately $2.4&nbsp;million in fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Sales
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Corporate and Other sales increased in fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal 2015, primarily due to intercompany commission revenue charged to our
	reportable segments by our global trading company in Hong Kong (which began operations at the beginning of fiscal 2016).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Eliminations
	increased in both fiscal 2016 and fiscal 2015 primarily due to higher sales from our Upholstery segment to our Retail segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Operating Margin
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our Corporate and Other operating loss was $8.0&nbsp;million higher in fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal 2015, primarily due to higher incentive
	compensation costs of $2.2&nbsp;million, as well as higher costs associated with our global trading company in Hong Kong and increased depreciation expense for our new world headquarters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	Corporate and Other operating loss was $1.6&nbsp;million lower in fiscal 2015 compared with fiscal 2014, mainly due to lower incentive compensation costs of $3.3&nbsp;million, partly offset by
	higher costs associated with the construction of our new world headquarters in fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	$0.6&nbsp;million restructuring expense in fiscal 2016 related mainly to rent expense for an idled showroom, rent expense for an idled office building, and accelerated depreciation expense for
	an idled asset. The $0.4&nbsp;million restructuring income in fiscal 2015 related mainly to the gain on the sale of an idled warehouse and inventory recoveries, somewhat offset by severance and
	benefit-related costs and rent expense for an idled showroom. The $4.8&nbsp;million restructuring expense in fiscal 2014 related mainly to fixed asset and inventory write-downs. All of these
	restructuring activities related to our Casegoods segment and the decision to cease domestic manufacturing and transition to an all-import model for our wood furniture, which we began in fiscal 2014.
	We expect the costs related to our restructuring efforts to be completed by the end of fiscal 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	32
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228987Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_CG10701_1_33">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228987Z10-K_HTM_BG10701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Other Income
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Other income was $1.5&nbsp;million higher in fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal 2015, primarily due to higher foreign currency exchange rate gains
	realized during fiscal 2016 than in fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Other
	income was $1.3&nbsp;million lower in fiscal 2015 compared with fiscal 2014, primarily due to lower foreign currency exchange rate gains realized during fiscal 2015 than in fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Income from Continued Dumping and Subsidy Offset Act
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Continued Dumping and Subsidy Offset Act of 2000 provided for distribution of duties collected by U.S. Customs and Border Protection from
	antidumping cases to domestic producers that supported the antidumping petition related to wooden bedroom furniture imported from China. We received pre-tax distributions of $0.1&nbsp;million during
	fiscal 2016. We received pre-tax distributions of $1.2&nbsp;million related to continuing operations and $4.2&nbsp;million related to discontinued operations during fiscal 2015. We did not receive
	any distributions during fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Income Taxes
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our effective tax rate for continuing operations was 35.3% for fiscal 2016, 35.0% for fiscal 2015, and 34.3% for fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Impacting
	our effective tax rate for fiscal 2016 was a tax benefit of $0.3&nbsp;million for the release of valuation allowances relating to certain U.S. state deferred tax assets. Absent discrete
	adjustments, the effective tax rate for continuing operations in fiscal 2016 would have been 35.6%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Impacting
	our effective tax rate for fiscal 2015 was a tax benefit of $0.4&nbsp;million for the release of valuation allowances relating to certain U.S. state deferred tax assets. Absent discrete
	adjustments, the effective tax rate for continuing operations in fiscal 2015 would have been 35.4%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Items
	impacting our effective tax rate for fiscal 2014 included a tax benefit of $1.2&nbsp;million for the release of valuation allowances relating to certain U.S. state deferred tax assets and a
	net tax benefit of $0.5&nbsp;million from other adjustments. Absent discrete adjustments, the effective tax rate for continuing operations in fiscal 2014 would have been 36.1%.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our sources of liquidity include cash and equivalents, short-term and long-term investments, cash from operations and amounts available under our
	credit facility. We believe these sources remain adequate to meet our short-term and long-term liquidity requirements, finance our long-term growth plans, meet debt service, and fulfill other cash
	requirements for day-to-day operations, dividends to shareholders and capital expenditures. We had cash and equivalents of $112.4&nbsp;million at April&nbsp;30, 2016, compared with
	$98.3&nbsp;million at April&nbsp;25, 2015. In addition, we had investments to enhance our returns on cash of $33.6&nbsp;million at April&nbsp;30, 2016, compared with $45.5&nbsp;million at
	April&nbsp;25, 2015. We reduced our investments during fiscal 2016, and used net income generated during the period and cash collections of accounts receivable, in order to fund acquisitions of
	retail stores, acquire assets through capital expenditures, fund increases in inventories, purchase shares of our stock and pay dividends to our shareholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	maintain a revolving credit facility secured primarily by all of our accounts receivable, inventory, and cash deposit and securities accounts. Availability under the agreement fluctuates according
	to a borrowing base calculated on eligible accounts receivable and inventory. The credit agreement includes affirmative and negative covenants that apply under certain circumstances, including a
	fixed-charge coverage ratio requirement that applies when excess availability under the line is less than certain thresholds. At April&nbsp;30, 2016, we were not subject to the fixed-charge coverage
	ratio requirement, had
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	33
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=34,EFW="2228987",CP="LA-Z-BOY",DN="1",CHK=959773,FOLIO='33',FILE='DISK123:[16ZAY1.16ZAY10701]CG10701A.;6',USER='ABEAULI',CD='20-JUN-2016;15:18' -->
<A NAME="A2228987Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_CG10701_1_34">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228987Z10-K_HTM_BG10701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	no
	borrowings outstanding under the agreement, and had excess availability of $146.9&nbsp;million of the $150.0&nbsp;million credit commitment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Capital
	expenditures for fiscal 2016 were $24.7&nbsp;million compared with $70.3&nbsp;million for fiscal 2015. Our capital expenditures were lower in fiscal 2016 compared with fiscal 2015 because
	the prior fiscal year included the construction of our new world headquarters. We have no material contractual commitments outstanding for future capital expenditures. We expect total capital
	expenditures to be in the range of $35&nbsp;million to $40&nbsp;million for all of fiscal 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	board of directors has sole authority to determine if and when future dividends will be declared and on what terms. We expect the board to continue declaring regular quarterly cash dividends for
	the foreseeable future, but it may discontinue doing so at any time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	believe our cash flows from operations, present cash and equivalents balance of $112.4&nbsp;million, short and long-term investments to enhance returns on cash of $33.6&nbsp;million, and
	current excess availability under our credit facility of $146.9&nbsp;million, will be sufficient to fund our business needs, including our fiscal 2017 contractual obligations of
	$132.7&nbsp;million as presented in our contractual obligations table. Included in our cash and cash equivalents at April&nbsp;30, 2016, is $24.3&nbsp;million held by foreign subsidiaries for
	which we have determined the amounts to be permanently reinvested.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	following table illustrates the main components of our cash flows:
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0.75PT;FONT-SIZE:0.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
	&#8203;
<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Operating Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During fiscal 2016, net cash provided by operating activities was $112.4&nbsp;million. Our cash provided by operating activities was primarily
	attributable to net income generated during fiscal 2016 and cash collections of accounts receivable of $10.7&nbsp;million, driven by the continued improvement in the financial health of our customer
	base, especially our independent La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries&reg; dealers. Somewhat offsetting these items were cash used to fund increases in inventories of $14.6&nbsp;million and a
	contribution to our pension plan of $7.0&nbsp;million. Our inventories were higher in fiscal 2016 primarily due to higher raw materials inventory, mainly leather and fabric sets, to improve our
	service levels to our customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	fiscal 2015, net cash provided by operating activities was $86.8&nbsp;million. Our cash provided by operating activities was primarily attributable to net income generated during fiscal 2015.
	Partly offsetting net income was cash used to fund increases in inventories and to settle incentive compensation awards. The $7.6&nbsp;million increase in inventories in fiscal 2015 was primarily
	due to higher
	raw materials inventory in our Upholstery segment as we positioned our inventory levels to meet our customer demands at that time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	fiscal 2014, net cash provided by operating activities was $90.8&nbsp;million. Our cash provided by operating activities was mainly the result of net income generated during the fiscal year
	and was partially offset by cash used to fund increases in inventories of $9.4&nbsp;million. The increase in inventories was due partially to our increase in company-owned La-Z-Boy Furniture
	Galleries&reg; stores during the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	34
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=35,EFW="2228987",CP="LA-Z-BOY",DN="1",CHK=471227,FOLIO='34',FILE='DISK123:[16ZAY1.16ZAY10701]CG10701A.;6',USER='ABEAULI',CD='20-JUN-2016;15:18' -->
<A NAME="A2228987Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_CG10701_1_35">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228987Z10-K_HTM_BG10701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	year,
	as well as higher finished goods inventories in our regional retail distribution centers, in order to service a larger number of La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries&reg; network stores.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Investing Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During fiscal 2016, net cash used for investing activities was $36.6&nbsp;million, which included $23.3&nbsp;million to fund the acquisition of
	retail stores, $24.7&nbsp;million for capital expenditures and $21.0&nbsp;million for purchases of investments, offset by proceeds of $28.7&nbsp;million from the sale of investments. Capital
	expenditures during the period primarily related to spending on manufacturing machinery and equipment, our continued ERP system implementation, our new e-commerce web site, and the relocation of one
	of our regional retail distribution centers. Additionally, the above uses of cash were partially offset by proceeds from the sale of assets, including assets previously held for sale, as well as a
	reduction in restricted cash which secures our outstanding letters of credit, of $3.7&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	fiscal 2015, net cash used for investing activities was $66.7&nbsp;million, which included $70.3&nbsp;million for capital expenditures. Capital expenditures during the period primarily
	related to spending on our new world headquarters, as well as spending on new stores and manufacturing machinery and equipment. In addition, we invested $6.6&nbsp;million of cash in fiscal 2015,
	primarily to purchase life insurance contracts related to our executive deferred compensation plan and our performance compensation retirement plan. Partly offsetting these items were proceeds from
	the sale of assets, including assets previously held for sale, as well as a reduction in restricted cash which secures our outstanding letters of credit, of $12.0&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	fiscal 2014, net cash used for investing activities was $45.0&nbsp;million, which consisted primarily of $33.7&nbsp;million in capital expenditures and a net $19.7&nbsp;million in
	investment purchases. These expenditures and investments were partially offset by $6.8&nbsp;million in proceeds from the sale of our Bauhaus business unit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Financing Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During fiscal 2016, net cash used for financing activities was $61.0&nbsp;million, including $44.1&nbsp;million for purchasing our common stock
	and $18.1&nbsp;million in dividend payments to our shareholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	fiscal 2015, net cash used for financing activities was $71.2&nbsp;million, including $51.9&nbsp;million for purchasing our common stock and $14.5&nbsp;million in dividend payments to our
	shareholders. Additionally, we used $7.6&nbsp;million of cash to pay down debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	fiscal 2014, net cash used for financing activities was $26.7&nbsp;million. We used $32.1&nbsp;million of cash to purchase common stock and $10.5&nbsp;million to fund dividend payments to
	our shareholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	board of directors has authorized the purchase of company stock. As of April&nbsp;30, 2016, 4.0&nbsp;million shares remained available for purchase pursuant to this authorization. The
	authorization has no expiration date. We purchased 1.7&nbsp;million shares during fiscal 2016 for a total of $44.1&nbsp;million. With the cash flows we anticipate generating in fiscal 2017, we
	expect to continue being opportunistic in purchasing company stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	35
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
